title: Workplace charging 'key to addressing' European EV uptake despite continued barriers
lead: Businesses are being urged to "lead by example" as new research details the continued barriers to workplace electric vehicle (EV) charging.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Opus One Solutions chosen by SPEN to provide local demand-side flexibility solution
lead: ​Opus One Solutions has been awarded a project by SP Energy Networks (SPEN) to help demonstrate the benefits of local demand-side flexibility.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Brearley doubles down on Ofgem independent system operator call, cites 'billion pound' benefits
lead: Ofgem chief executive Jonathan Brearley has assured that the goal of the regulator's recommendation of creating a fully independent system operator (ISO) is to support a "robust system" that can result in "billion pound" savings.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EDF extends Landis+Gyr contract to help it meet smart meter targets
lead: ​Energy management solutions company Landis+Gyr has secured a major contract with EDF for smart meters.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Disruptors: Rebel Energy’s Dan Bates on aiming for big business as good business
lead: Current± caught up with Rebel Energy CEO Dan Bates to discuss the challenges and the opportunities of launching a supplier in the UK, and what this “Rebel with a cause” will look like.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem calls for independent system operator as it cites 'potential National Grid conflicts of interest'
lead: ​Pointing to what it described as “potential” conflicts of interest within National Grid, Ofgem has issued a recommendation for a fully independent system operator (ISO).
author: Alice Grundy

title: Shell acquires on-street EV charging company ubitricity
lead: ​Shell has expanded into on-street charging, thanks to the acquisition of electric vehicle (EV) charging company ubitricity.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ohme launches EV charging app that can save drivers £1,300 a year
lead: ​Electric vehicle (EV) charging company Ohme has launched a new app allowing owners to control the costs of charging vehicles.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: National Grid ESO to unlock stacking of assets in Dynamic Containment and BM
lead: ​National Grid ESO is looking to unlock stacking within the Balancing Mechanism (BM) as part of the development of the Dynamic Containment service.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UKPN predicts a 3,000% growth in EVs by 2030 while heat pumps set to hit 700k
lead: ​There could be up to 4.5 million electric vehicles (EVs) and over 700,000 electric heat pumps by 2030 across London, the east and south east.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UK's second interconnector with France starts flowing at full capacity in ‘latest feat of world class engineering’
lead: ​The second electricity interconnector between the UK and France is now able to flow low carbon electricity between the two countries at full capacity.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EV charging tech firm Indra secures Clean Growth Fund investment
lead: ​Indra has secured a £6 million investment led by the Clean Growth Fund alongside Gulf Oil International.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Future Homes Standard: Heat pumps to be ‘the primary heating technology for new homes’
lead: The government has restated its commitment to heat pumps following the most recent Future Homes Standard consultation.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BP Pulse partners with Jumptech as it looks to expand charger installations beyond 100,000
lead: ​BP Pulse has signed a new contract with Jumptech to help grow electric vehicle (EV) charger installations.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Technology no longer a barrier to ‘fully functional, local flexibility markets’: A look at the Cornwall LEM
lead: Current± caught up with Dan Nicholls, programme manager of the Cornwall LEM, following the end of the landmark flexibility project to discuss the successes and the lessons learnt.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Customers’ bills to jump with price cap increase of £66 as wholesale energy prices recover
lead: ​The default tariff price cap is set to increase by £66 from April 2021 as wholesale power prices jump.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ESO and ENA call on generators to make hardware upgrades to improve network resilience
lead: ​National Grid ESO and the Energy Networks Association (ENA) are urging generators to claim "thousands of pounds" in funding towards mandatory hardware upgrades.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Autonomous energy assistant to facilitate domestic DSR in new Living Lab trial
lead: ​An autonomous digital energy assistant is to be trialed by Edinburgh-based Amp X in 50 Living Lab homes run by the Energy Systems Catapult.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Delayed TERRE implementation course to be further developed in early 2021
lead: ​TERRE implementation course set to be released early in 2021, with a TERRE-like mechanism operating in standalone mode being assessed.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Councils plan to install just 35 on-street EV chargers on average by 2025
lead: ​Across the next four years, only 9,317 on-street electric vehicle (EV) chargers are planned for installation by local councils, according to new data released by Centrica.
author: Alice Grundy
